{{About|the disk image emulator|the collection of tools for managing Unix services|daemontools}} {{Primary|date=August 2010}} {{Infobox software | name = Daemon Tools | download = http://www.daemon-tools.cc | logo = [[File:Daemon tools logo.png|30px]] | screenshot = [[File:Dtp.png|300px]] | caption = Daemon Tools Pro running under [[Windows 7]] | developer = DT Soft Ltd | latest_release_version = *'''Lite''': 4.45.1 / {{Start date and age|2011|08|02|df=yes}} *'''Pro''': 4.41.0315 / {{Start date and age|2011|08|17|df=yes}} *'''Net''': 4.36.0310 / {{Start date and age|2010|07|29|df=yes}} | operating system = [[Windows 98]], [[Windows 2000]] SP4, [[Windows XP]], [[Windows Vista]], [[Windows Server 2008]], [[Windows 7]], [[Windows Server 2008 R2]]http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/products/dtLite#compatible | genre = [[Virtual drive|Disc image emulator]] | language = 38 Languages with additional translation packs[http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f50/ Translation Packs] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]]
(various licenses) | website = {{URL|http://www.daemon-tools.cc/}} }} {{Infobox |header1 =
Supported file types
|label1 = File Types |data1 = Details |label2 = b5t |data2 = [[BlindWrite]] |label3 = b6t |data3 = BlindWrite |label4 = bwt |data4 = BlindRead |label5 = [[.ccd|ccd]] |data5 = [[CloneCD]] |label6 = cdi |data6 = [[DiscJuggler]] |label7 = [[Cue sheet (computing)|cue]] |data7 = Cue Sheet |label8 = [[ISO image|iso]] |data8 = Standard ISO |label9 = isz |data9 = Compressed ISO |label10 = [[MDS file|mds]] |data10 = Media Descriptor File |label11 = mdx |data11 = Media Data eXtended |label12 = [[NRG (file format)|nrg]] |data12 = [[Nero Burning ROM]] disc image |label13 = [[.ape|ape]] |data13 = APE images |label14 =[[flac]] |data14 = Free Lossless Audio Codec images |below = As of July 2011{{cite web |url=http://www.daemon-help.com/en/windows_integration_lite/file_associations_lite.html |title=File Associations |work=Daemon Tools Help |publisher=DAEMON Tools |accessdate=23 November 2011}} }} '''Daemon Tools''' (styled '''DAEMON Tools''' by its creators) is a [[Virtual drive|disk image emulator]] and [[optical disc authoring software|optical disc authoring program]] for [[Microsoft Windows]]. Daemon Tools was originally a furtherance in the development of another program, ''Generic SafeDisc emulator'', and incorporated all of its features. The program claims to be able to defeat most [[copy protection]] schemes such as [[SafeDisc]] and [[SecuROM]].{{cite web|url=http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/gamedb.php?letter=all|title=Supported games and protections database}} It is currently compatible with Windows XP, Windows Vista and Windows 7. DAEMON Tools has a special mode for proper operation of copies of discs with advanced protection ([[SafeDisc]], [[SecuRom]] and [[LaserLock]], CDCOPS, [[StarForce]] and Protect CD), which are used on some discs with games.{{Cite web |url=http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/news/bbe0f423e15c028735eadcce333289e6 |title=DAEMON Tools Lite 4.35.5 represents full Windows 7 support |date=23 October 2009 |accessdate=3 November 2009}} ==Editions== Versions prior to v4.00 had only one edition. That edition was [[freeware]], had no [[adware]], and was solely an imaging disc-emulation software (no image conversion, creation, burning, and so forth). Currently, four editions of the product exist: Lite, Pro Standard, Pro Advanced, and Net. DAEMON Tools Net is an enterprise-oriented edition containing modern network features. A feature comparison is given below:{{cite web |url=http://www.daemon-tools.cc/products/compare|title=DAEMON-Tools.cc :: Products :: Compare}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! Feature || Lite || Pro Standard || Pro Advanced || Net |- | iSCSI Server || {{No}} || {{No}} || {{No}} || {{Yes}} (up to 16 targets) |- | Image Catalog sharing || {{No}} || {{No}} || {{No}} || {{Yes}} |- | Graphical user interface || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image creation || {{Yes}} (without preset profiles) || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image editing || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Command-line interface || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Maximum number of virtual [[SCSI]] CD/DVD devices || 4 || 16 || 32 || 32 |- | Maximum number of virtual [[Integrated Drive Electronics|IDE]] CD/DVD devices || 0 || 0 || 4 || 4 |- | Image mounting to virtual devices || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image mounting to File System folders || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image collection's management || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image compression/encryption || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Shell extensions || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | System Tray Agent || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Virtual device property monitoring || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | Image converter || {{No}} || {{No}} || {{Yes}} || {{Yes}} |- | License type || {{Free|[[Freemium]]}}{{Ref|A|A}} || {{Nonfree|[[Trialware]]}} || {{Nonfree|[[Trialware]]}} || {{Nonfree|[[Trialware]]}} |} ;Notes: :A. {{Note|A}} Free for non-commercial use without technical support. Technical support and the right to use commercially may be purchased.{{cite web|title=FAQ: Is DAEMON Tools software free or not?|url=http://www.daemon-tools.cc/eng/support/faq#free_or_not|work=daemon-tools.cc|accessdate=21 November 2011|quote=DAEMON Tools Lite is free for home and non-business use. In case you want to use DAEMON Tools in any organization, you need to buy a license.}}{{cite web |title=Installation |url=http://daemon-help.com/en/installation_notes_lite/installation_lite.html |work=DAEMON Tools Lite Help |publisher=DAEMON Tools |accessdate=21 November 2011 |quote=[Inside third screenshot] Support is provided only for Paid License users.}} ==Y.A.S.U.== {{Infobox software | name = Y.A.S.U | logo = | screenshot = | caption = '''YASU 1.4''', hiding a Daemon-Tools virtual drive from SecuROM and SafeDisc | author = | developer = sYk0 | released = | latest release version = 1.6.9040 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2009|02|04|df=yes}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | programming language = | operating system = [[Microsoft Windows]] | platform = | language = [[English language|English]] | status = | genre = | license = [[Freeware]] | website = [http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f40/ YASU Support Site] }} Y.A.S.U (Yet Another SecuROM Utility) is a very small tool that works as a "SCSI-drive protector". It was created by sYk0, who also created [[CureROM]] (but CureROM uses an alternative method to protect SCSI drives) Itâs a simple utility that can be used to hide emulated drives from [[SecuROM|SecuROM 7]] and [[SafeDisc|SafeDisc 4]]. YASU is a companion program for Daemon Tools and currently being hosted, supported and maintained by the Daemon Tools team. On March 4 of 2009, sYk0 announced development of '''Omen''' which is to succeed development of YASU.[http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f40/omen-future-anti-blacklists-near-23216/ Omen: The future of Anti-Blacklists is near... - THE DAEMON TOOLS FORUM] As of January 2010, development of Omen has been abandoned.[http://forum.daemon-tools.cc/f40/omen-future-anti-blacklists-near-23216/index4.html#post123255 Omen: The future of Anti-Blacklists is near... - Page 4 - THE DAEMON TOOLS FORUM] ==File format== The default file format of Daemon Tools is Media Data eXtended (MDX). MDX is a [[disc image]] file format similar to [[MDS file|MDS/MDF images]]. It supports all of MDS/MDF format features except that all data is in one monolithic file only. The files of these types bear the filename extension of .mdx.{{Cite web |url = http://daemonpro-help.com/en/glossary.html |title = Glossary |work = DAEMON Tools Pro Help |publisher = DAEMON Tools |accessdate = 12 May 2011 |quote = mdx / mds (Media Data eXtended / Media Descriptor Files) â these formats are developed by DAEMON Tools developers.}}{{Cite web |url = http://www.file-extensions.org/mdx-file-extension |title = File extension MDX: Daemon Tools Media Data eXtended file |publisher = File-Extensions.org |date = 11 May 2011 |accessdate = 15 May 2011}} MDX file contains [[metadata]] of original media - specifically the main physical parameters of disc, such as layer breaks, sessions, tracks and other. It could be described as being an archive file containing all data from a CD/DVD. It also supports [[data compression]]. MDX file includes the [[magic number]] "MEDIA DESCRIPTOR" at the beginning of the file. ==See also== *[[Comparison of ISO image software]] *[[SCSI Pass-Through Direct]] (SPTD) *[[Virtual drive]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.daemon-tools.cc Official Daemon Tools website] * [http://www.daemon-help.com/ Official Daemon Tools Lite Help/Documentation] * [http://www.daemonpro-help.com/ Official Daemon Tools Pro Help/Documentation] {{Optical disc image software}} {{Disk image emulators software}} [[Category:Disk image emulators]] [[Category:Rootkits]] [[Category:Windows-only software]] [[bg:Daemon Tools]] [[da:Daemon Tools]] [[de:Daemon Tools]] [[es:DAEMON Tools]] [[fr:DAEMON Tools]] [[ko:ë°ëª¬ í´ì¤]] [[it:Daemon Tools]] [[lt:DAEMON Tools]] [[nl:DAEMON Tools]] [[ja:DAEMON Tools]] [[pl:DAEMON Tools]] [[pt:DAEMON Tools]] [[ru:DAEMON Tools]] [[fi:Daemon Tools]] [[sv:Daemon Tools]] [[uk:Daemon Tools]] [[vi:DAEMON Tools]] [[zh:DAEMON Tools]]
